data.title: BMC Executive Council
data.meta_description: BMC helps customers run and reinvent their businesses with open, scalable, and modular solutions to complex IT problems.
data.text:
Marco Bocciarelli serves as Head of the End User Services Division at the European Space Agency (ESA), a role he has held since 2019. He has worked at the organization since 1998, starting as a Resource Controller. Most recently, Bocciarelli was a Corporate Business Process Manager at ESA. Before joining the organization, he spent nearly a decade at Thales Group as a Project Controller for ARTEMIS and SICRAL Projects within the Thales Alenia Space division. Bocciarelli earned a Masterʼs degree in Economics from Sapienza University of Rome. Marco Bocciarelli also speaks French, Italian and Swedish.

Dennis Cetnarowski is the Chief Information Officer of BetaNXT with more than 25 years of IT experience in the financial services industry.

Dennis is responsible for overseeing the company’s Information and Technology operational requirements. He has deep expertise in many aspects of technology including server virtualization, cloud services, application management, software engineering, performance and capacity management, networks, storage, business continuity planning, disaster recovery, data center management, information security, risk and compliance, and employee talent and skillset management.

Additionally, Dennis is responsible for the transformation of the technology operations to ensure the most cost efficient, modern and open platform is meeting evolving business requirements.

Dennis has a B.S. in Information Technology, A.A.S in Computer Networking, Security Industry Institute(SII) Graduate of SIFMA/The Wharton School, and a volunteer Firefighter/AEMT/Training Officer in his local town.

I am a mechanical engineer with 20 years’ work experience as a senior manager, manager, consultant, key account manager, sales engineer and service coordinator in both Swedish and international companies. My personality is characterized by an open and trustworthy manner, good social skills and professionalism. I am a responsible person, have good ability to see possible solutions and I deliver results. I am a generalist who can see both the details and the strategic perspective and I enjoy a role where I can impact the business for the better. As a leader, I have the ability to create functional groups, get different parties working together, inspire confidence and empower people to reach their full potential.

Specialties: IoT, Leadership, Management, Software development, Portfolio Management, Smart metering, AMI & AMR systems and field activities linked to such implementations, Project managment, Business and IT Develpoment and Organisation management.

Nicola O’Connor is AIB’s Chief Information Security and IT Risk Officer, a role in which she is responsible for ensuring the integrity of both information and systems, while also defining the strategy to future proof the organisation. Nicola is an experienced executive, previously holding a number of senior management positions in AIB including Head of Support & Control. Prior to this she commenced her career in Intel, where she held a number of technical roles. She holds a BSc in Computer Engineering from UCC.

Jon Ozanne is the Chief Information Officer at Balfour Beatty and is responsible for the UK IT, cyber and digital teams. Since joining Balfour Beatty in April 2015, Jon has reimagined the IT function which is now seen as the delivery engine of digital transformation.

Prior to joining Balfour Beatty, Jon was IT Director for Qinetiq Plc where he delivered a transformation of the IT operating and resource model. Jon is an active people leader with a passion for technology and a relentless focus to drive culture change and digital transformation for the benefit of the business.

During 25+ years I have enjoyed leading business Units and companies in the Technology and communications industries to help transform teams, companies and business in Colombia and Multi Countries

I have had the privilege of collaborating alongside talented and respected professionals at Compaq, HP and Hewlett Packard Enterprise as Managing Director and Business Manager. We have enjoyed working together with our customers and partners to meet their challenges, pursue growth opportunities and transform their business.

My areas of expertise include balanced capacities for strategic planning and execution, Sales Management, channels development, implementation of new business models, accelerate growth, increase market share, achieving operational excellence and strengthen relationships with senior executives and public agents.

Since 2019, Pedro is responsible for the IT Operations and Data Centres of European Markets, and he also manages the Technology centres which is a growing team of nearly 15,000 employees across multiple locations.

Pedro joined Vodafone in 2015 as the CIO for Vodafone UK where he led the IT and Digital transformation that positioned Vodafone UK as a leading example of a digital organisation.

Previously, Pedro was the CIO of Oi, the largest telecom in Brazil and the CIO at Portugal Telecom (now Altice Portugal) for 8 years. He also worked in McKinsey for 5 years and at Procter & Gamble for 5 years.

Bernd Schwenk has 27 years of experience in various roles in the IT industry. He joined ADVA Optical Networking SE in 2002 as Vice President Information Technology. In 2016 he moved into the CIO position at ADVA.

During his time at ADVA, he built a global IT organization and transformed the role of IT from a traditional setup into modern service organization. Together with other business departments he’s driving IT innovation projects to transform ADVA into a digital enterprise. During his time, he completed several IT projects integrating acquired companies. His role includes responsibilities of cyber security, enterprise architecture, cloud solutions (SaaS, IaaS), management information system and IT infrastructure.

Kimberly Simon is senior vice president, Business Operations for the Processing business of Mastercard Technology. In this role, she is responsible for protecting and standardizing the business operations practice for the Americas, SA, MEA, Europe, and Turkey regions. The past 9 months has been heavily focused on the demonetization in India and fueling the profitability of the processing business with customers in India (i.e. Airtel).

Prior to this role, Ms. Simon was senior business leader in the Digital Space leading the Service Management team. She was responsible for the management of the ApplePay and SamsungPay launches and ensured it was executed flawlessly. She also established the first Launch Playbook within Mastercard that has been the model for all launches within Mastercard.

Since joining Mastercard, Ms. Simon has served in various leadership roles. She has more than 18 years of experience in the financial and payments industries including 7 years of experience in settlement and fraud. Before joining Mastercard, Ms. Simon served as a director for Enterprise Rent-a-Car payment department. In this position she was responsible for ACI and settlement for the business. Prior to this position, she held roles as senior software engineer, process engineer, as well as database administrator at Monsanto.

Ms. Simon holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Applied Mathematics, with a minor in Computer Science from Saint Louis University.

Industrial and Systems Engineer, with a specialization in Strategic Management and Corporate Finance, as well as several courses, seminars, and diplomas, including one in Digital Transformation and Innovation at MIT. He has over 35 years of experience in Technology Management and has led many technology projects such as Core Changes in Banking, Insurance, E-commerce, and Healthcare. He currently works for Coomeva, a Cooperative Business Group that owns 14 companies, as the Corporate CIO and is also responsible for the Group's Digital Transformation. He serves on various boards and steering committees and has been a teacher and business advisor. Finally, he is a father of two children, Mariana Torres Sanchez and Juan Felipe Torres Sanchez, born of his union with also an Engineer, Diana Cristina Sanchez.

José Manuel Valiño Blanco, General Director of IT, Information, Processes and Operations of ABANCA. He began his career in a Big Four and was part of Europa Management Consulting in Madrid as managing partner. President of META Group Iberia. He was Deputy General Director of Systems at Caixa Galicia and Nova Galicia Banco.

He has held, among others, the positions of president of Hal España (payment systems), president of Softgal (now Indra), president of Softgalnet SoftgalGestion and member of the Board of Directors of the companies Sermepa, Camerfirma, Seglán, Ozona and Banco Etcheverría.

He studied MSC Industrial Engineering at the Polytechnic University of Madrid and completed the Tuck Executive Program at The Tuck School of Business (Darmouth College) Delivering Information Services at Harvard Business School and Reinventing Your Business Strategy at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

Ayman Sayed was named president and chief executive officer of BMC Software, Inc., in October 2019.

Prior to joining BMC, Ayman was president and chief product officer of CA Technologies, a $4.25 billion Fortune 500 company, where he was responsible for the vision, strategy, and development of their portfolio of products and solutions. During his tenure, he led a significant transformation of CA into higher-growth businesses including infrastructure software management, security, automation, and DevOps.

Ayman previously served as senior vice president at Cisco Systems where he led the Network Operating System Technology Group, responsible for the software on which nearly every Cisco networking product runs. He helped Cisco pioneer the programmable networks arena and drove innovation broadly across networking software, which enabled the evolution of the intelligent network to support application awareness and the Internet of Things.

Ayman holds a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering from Cairo University.

Eduarda Camacho is senior vice president and chief customer officer (CCO) of BMC Software, Inc. She is responsible for a cohesive and impactful Customer Success function that helps BMC customers on their journey to an Autonomous Digital Enterprise. She also serves as the chief customer advocate, or the voice of the customer, focused on developing and implementing a value-driven customer success program that champions our customers and keeps them at the center of all we do.

An accomplished customer success executive, Eduarda has over 24 years of leadership experience within Presales, Partner, Professional Services, and Customer Success organizations as an executive vice president with global responsibility.

Before joining BMC, she was executive vice president and CCO at PTC and led worldwide Customer Success, Professional Services, and the Cloud Services business. Prior to PTC, Eduarda worked at several industrial companies and as a freelance journalist.

As a true global citizen Eduarda brings diverse cultural experiences to the leadership team from living and working in EMEA, APAC, and North America. She is engaged with a number of organizations and industry associations that support the development and excellence of customer success teams and is an avid supporter of initiatives that elevate talent in the organization.

Eduarda graduated from the Universidade Nova de Lisboa and has completed an Executive Education Program at Harvard Business School for leading Professional Services firms.

Paul Cant was named chief revenue officer for BMC Software, Inc., in April 2023, and has global responsibility for the BMC sales organization.

Paul is a 17-year BMC veteran, who most recently held the leadership role of geo vice president of international sales. His leadership over the past three years has resulted in unprecedented growth for the Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Russia, and Asia-Pacific regions.

His tenure at BMC includes various sales leadership roles that supported the company’s expansion into new markets, the introduction of new products and solutions, and managing the evolution of sales operations across teams and regions. Paul joined the company through an acquisition 2008.

Ram Chakravarti is chief technology officer for BMC Software, Inc. In this role, he oversees the BMC Innovation Labs as well as the company’s overall technology strategy, common architecture, corporate development, and shared services including user experience design, quality assurance, and cybersecurity.

Prior to joining BMC, Ram was a director at KKR Capstone focused on value creation in KKR’s technology investments in private equity and growth equity.

Prior to working at KKR, Ram was an associate partner at McKinsey & Company, where he advised clients on large-scale, multi-year digital transformations, and established McKinsey’s Digital Architecture Service Line in North America. Earlier in his career, Ram worked at Oracle, Ariba, tech startups and Merck in a variety of software engineering and architecture roles.

Ram holds master’s degrees in decision sciences and organizational dynamics from the University of Pennsylvania and in Electrical Engineering from the Indian Institute of Science. He has co-authored a book on R&D and IT portfolio management which is being used in graduate programs at the University of Pennsylvania and other schools in the US.
